excerpt: 13th-century church including the Bamberg Horseman statue & the marble tomb of Emperor Henry II.
detail_description: Bamberg Cathedral, also known as the Imperial Cathedral, is a 13th-century church that holds significant historical and artistic treasures. Originally built by Emperor Henry II, it features four spires and houses the tomb of Pope Clement II, the marble tombs of Henry II and Queen Cunigunda, as well as the famous Bamberg Horseman statue. The cathedral's late Romanesque and early Gothic architecture showcases remarkable sculptures, carvings, and choirs.
name: Bamberg Cathedral

excerpt: Landmark building & porcelain museum situated on an island accessible by pedestrian bridges.
detail_description: The Altes Rathaus, also known as the Old Town Hall, is a historic landmark and porcelain museum located on an island accessible by pedestrian bridges. Dating back to the 14th century, it has a fascinating backstory: due to the Bishop of Bamberg's refusal to allocate land for a town hall, residents built it on stakes in the River Regnitz. The building received a Baroque update in the 18th century and is adorned with famous frescoes.
name: Altes Rathaus

excerpt: Well-preserved old town with a landmark cathedral & centuries-old half-timbered houses.
detail_description: Bamberg Old Town is a captivating destination that boasts a rich tapestry of history and stunning architecture. This UNESCO World Heritage site features beautifully preserved half-timbered houses and the iconic Bamberg Cathedral, which stands as a testament to its medieval roots. One of the highlights is the Water City Hall, uniquely perched on an artificial island in the Regnitz River, connected by charming stone bridges.
name: Bamberg old town

excerpt: Bamberg is a town in northern Bavaria, Germany, laid out over 7 hills where the Regnitz and Main rivers meet. Its old town preserves structures from the 11th to 19th centuries including the muraled Altes Rathaus (town hall), which occupies an island in the Regnitz reached by arched bridges. The Romanesque Bamberg Cathedral, begun in the 11th century, features 4 towers and numerous stone carvings.
detail_description: Bamberg, located in northern Bavaria, Germany, is a picturesque town set on 7 hills at the confluence of the Regnitz and Main rivers. Its old town boasts well-preserved structures spanning from the 11th to 19th centuries, including the striking Altes Rathaus and the Romanesque Bamberg Cathedral with its impressive stone carvings.
name: Bamberg

excerpt: Enduring family-run brewery specializing in smoked beer, also serving typical Bavarian food.
detail_description: Schlenkerla, Rauchbierbrauerei is a well-established family-owned brewery known for its unique smoked beer and traditional Bavarian cuisine. The brewery offers a variety of beers including Schlenkerla Helles, Marzen, Spezial Lager, and Zwergla. In addition to these familiar options, they also feature rare selections like Weyermann's Imperial Stout and constantly rotate unusual brews that are not commonly found elsewhere.
name: Schlenkerla, Rauchbierbrauerei

excerpt: Over 40 rooms in a 17th century palace with ornate ceilings, tapestries & art plus rose garden.
detail_description: The Neue Residenz Bamberg is a grand 17th-century palace with over 40 rooms, featuring ornate ceilings, tapestries, and art. The palace boasts a rose garden and is located just outside the Cathedral in an open square. Built as the home of the Prince Bishop of Bamberg, it showcases ostentatious interiors designed by the same architect as Wurzburg Residenz.
name: Neue Residenz Bamberg

detail_description: This museum is dedicated to Franconian beer and everything associated with it. It has an extensive collection of brewing equipment, including beer mats and tankards from across Franconia. The museum is well-maintained, with a bar for visitors to try the various beers on offer. It is not suitable for those with mobility issues or who cannot do a fair number of stairs.
name: Franconian Brewery Museum Bamberg

excerpt: A city history museum is housed in this building complex that dates to the 11th century.
detail_description: Old Court is a historic building complex in Bamberg that dates back to the 11th century. It is part of the city's rich history and is located near the Bamberg cathedral square, alongside the cathedral and the New Residence.
name: Old Court

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bamberg, Germany, the Bamberg Diocesan Museum is a captivating destination for art lovers and history buffs alike. Situated near iconic landmarks like the Bamberg Cathedral and Alte Hofhaltung, this museum showcases an extraordinary collection of sacred artworks that span from the Middle Ages to the Baroque period. Visitors can marvel at exquisite textiles and vestments, including regalia worn by notable figures such as Holy Roman Emperor Henry II and Pope Clement II.
name: Bamberg Diocesan Museum

detail_description: Klein Venedig, also known as Little Venice, is a picturesque row of small half-timbered cottages located along the east bank of the Regnitz River in Bamberg. These charming houses were once inhabited by fishermen and their families, giving the area its name which means 'fishery'. The cottages are built on poles directly over the water and are adorned with tiny gardens and terraces.
name: Klein Venedig

excerpt: Church in an expansive, historic former monastery featuring gardens with scenic city views.
detail_description: Michelsberg Monastery, located in Bamberg, is a historic former monastery with a picturesque rose garden and panoramic views of the city. The church, founded in 1015 and rebuilt in neo-Gothic style after a fire, features a stunning ceiling painting known as the 'Garden of Heaven.' While ongoing construction may obstruct some views, visitors can still explore the monastery museum.
name: Michelsberg monastery

excerpt: Relaxed tavern featuring smoked beer, regional dishes & a cozy dining room, plus a patio.
detail_description: Spezial-Keller is a charming tavern in Bamberg, Germany, offering a relaxed atmosphere and scenic views of the city skyline. To reach the garden, visitors take a picturesque walk through a residential area before arriving at the cozy dining room or patio. The establishment is known for its smoked beer and regional dishes, making it an ideal spot to savor a Spezial Lager or occasionally a Spezial U. Additionally, guests can enjoy full meals and even jazz brunches on Sundays.
name: Spezial-Keller

detail_description: The Rose Garden, located behind the New Residence since 1602 and expanded in a Renaissance style in 1733, features Baroque statues added around 1760. The garden showcases representations of Roman gods and playful angels symbolizing virtues. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views from the garden and explore the grand apartments at the former prince-bishops palace.
name: Rose garden

detail_description: The State Gallery New Residence in Bamberg, Germany, is a cultural gem offering a beautiful collection of artworks including Baroque and Old German pieces. The gallery's staff is known for their friendliness and helpfulness. Visitors can immerse themselves in the Old German section featuring works by Lucas Cranach the Elder and be captivated by the larger-than-life emperors depicted in the Imperial Hall's frescoes.
name: State Gallery New Residence

detail_description: St. Martin's Church, also known as Pfarrkirche St. Martin, is a prominent baroque church in Bamberg with notable Jesuit architecture and stunning frescoes adorning its walls and ceilings. The highlight of the church is its impressive pulpit and the false dome that creates an illusion of a real dome on the ceiling. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful atmosphere inside this magnificent building, which serves as a great escape from the heat and hustle of the town.
name: Kath. Kirche St. Martin

detail_description: Located in the heart of Bamberg, Ambräusianum is a popular brew pub that attracts many tourists due to its central location. Despite being established in 2004, it has managed to capture the essence of the town's older venues. The brewery offers English food menus and is known for its young yet traditional approach to brewing. The brew kettles are situated within the pub, providing a unique experience for visitors.
name: Ambräusianum GmbH

detail_description: Located in the picturesque old town of Bamberg, Riffelmacher Conditorei-Café-Eiscreme is a charming ice cream parlor that offers a delightful selection of homemade creamy ice cream, along with a variety of coffee, cakes, and delicious breakfast options. The cozy atmosphere invites visitors to indulge in the carefully crafted ice cream flavors, ranging from classic to fruity and unique.
name: Riffelmacher Conditorei-Café-Eiscreme

detail_description: International Artists Villa Concordia, located in the stunning historical part of Bamberg, was originally built by an 18th-century owner who loved hosting extravagant parties. The villa was constructed right on the water's edge to allow guests to arrive by boat. Today, it has been transformed into an art museum showcasing the works of both local and international artists. Visitors can explore the beautiful gardens and admire the stunning building situated near the canal.
name: International Artists Villa Concordia

detail_description: When visiting Bamberg, don't miss the Shop der Bamberger Symphoniker - Bamberg Symphony Shop. This charming town offers a delightful shopping experience where you can immerse yourself in German culture. It's a must-visit destination for anyone exploring Germany and looking for unique souvenirs or gifts.
name: Shop der Bamberger Symphoniker - Bamberg Symphony Shop

detail_description: Grüner Markt in Bamberg is a charming destination that offers a glimpse into the heart of Bavaria. This well-preserved medieval city boasts timeless waterways, such as the poetic dwelling of Little Venice, and a rich history that dates back thousands of years. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk along Linker Regnitzarm and explore attractions like Alte Hofhaltung Bamberg and the magnificent cathedral.
name: Grüner Markt

detail_description: Our Lady's Parish Church, also known as Upper Parish or Obere Pfarre, is a well-preserved Gothic church in Bamberg. Dating back to the late 13th century, it has survived numerous renovations and even a bombing during World War II. The church features original fittings and architecture from the 14th century, including a late Gothic choir and a simple nave added later on.
name: Our Lady's Parish Church (Upper Parish)

excerpt: Longtime museum housing historical objects from prehistoric times through the current century.
detail_description: The Historical Museum Bamberg, located in the former Benedictine abbey of St. Michael, offers a captivating journey through the rich history of Bamberg from the Middle Ages to modern times. Housed in the Renaissance buildings of the Old Court, this museum showcases a diverse collection that spans from prehistoric artifacts to contemporary treasures.
name: Historical Museum Bamberg

detail_description: E.T.A. Hoffmann-Haus is a must-visit for those intrigued by the life and work of the renowned writer, composer, and artist E.T.A. Hoffmann. This small museum is located in the historical residence where Hoffmann lived from 1809 to 1813. Visitors can explore the living quarters and gain insight into how this great artist lived and worked.
name: E.T.A. Hoffmann-Haus

detail_description: The Sammlung Ludwig Bamberg im Alten Rathaus, also known as the Ludwig Collection in the Old Town Hall, is a remarkable museum showcasing an extensive private collection of faience and porcelain. Housed in the picturesque Altes Rathaus since 1995, this collection is a testament to the passion and dedication of collectors Peter and Irene Ludwig.
name: Sammlung Ludwig Bamberg im Alten Rathaus I Museen der Stadt Bamberg

excerpt: Landmark fountain in a city square, featuring a statue of Roman god Neptune with a gilded trident.
detail_description: Neptunsbrunnen is a historical landmark located in the bustling Gruner Markt square of Bamberg. The fountain features a statue of the Roman god Neptune holding a gilded trident. It's a popular meeting point and offers stone seating to relax, although it can get cold. Nearby, there are regular markets and shopping opportunities, making it an ideal spot to soak up the town's charm. This beautiful fountain is definitely worth visiting when exploring the historical German town of Bamberg.
name: Gabelmoo (Neptunsbrunnen)

excerpt: Roast pork, schnitzel & dumplings, washed down with smoked beer, at a long-standing, rustic tavern.
detail_description: Brauerei Spezial is a long-standing tavern in Bamberg, known for its roast pork, schnitzel, and dumplings paired with their signature smoked beer. The brewery follows traditional methods by malting its own grain over a beechwood fire instead of purchasing it from a malting facility. Located on the historic Obere Konigstrasse, it's just a short walk from Schlenkerla and the iconic Altes Rathaus.
name: Brauerei Spezial

detail_description: Brauerei Greifenklau is a local favorite in Franconia, known for its delicious Schaufele and traditional side dishes like Kloss, Sauerkraut, and mashed kale. While the brewery may seem secluded, the 15-minute walk up the Kaulberg offers stunning city views on the way back. The beer garden at Greifenklau provides a regal view of the Altenburg from atop a ridge that once housed its beer cellars.
name: Brauerei Greifenklau

excerpt: Burgers with a range of toppings, plus Franconian brews, in a casual setup with a beer garden.
detail_description: Zapfhahn in Bamberg offers a blend of American flair and Franconian coziness. The restaurant provides a diverse menu featuring burgers, sandwiches, steaks, and an extensive drink selection including Franconian beer, wine, and cocktails. Whether you prefer the cozy interior or the beer garden, Zapfhahn caters to all tastes with options for vegetarians and regional cuisine.
name: Zapfhahn

excerpt: Half-timbered brewery & restaurant established in 1533, with wood-paneled rooms & a stepped terrace.
detail_description: Klosterbräu Bamberg is a historic half-timbered brewery and restaurant that has been serving guests since 1533. The establishment offers wood-paneled rooms and a stepped terrace for visitors to enjoy. One of the standout dishes at Klosterbräu is the schauferla, a roasted quarter pork shoulder with intense savory sauce, which is considered the best in Bamberg.
name: Klosterbräu Bamberg

detail_description: Fässla Keller Biergarten in Bamberg is a lively spot where locals gather for cheaper beer and a vibrant atmosphere. The central alleyway is always bustling with people enjoying the good selection of beers. Just across the road from Brauerei Spezial, Fässla offers a traditional beer hall experience with plenty of wood decor and stenciled hops along the walls.
name: Fässla Keller Biergarten Bamberg

detail_description: Located just steps away from the Schlenkerla Brewery, SpitzRein is a charming and highly-rated cafe in Bamberg. The cafe offers a delightful selection of delicious cakes and comforting coffee, making it a perfect stop for those with a sweet tooth. What sets SpitzRein apart is its focus on gluten-free and vegan options, with at least half of its pies and cakes being vegan.
name: SpitzRein

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bamberg's historic old town, Cafe am Dom is a delightful haven for food lovers and coffee enthusiasts alike. This charming café boasts an impressive array of delectable treats, from traditional pastries to exquisite chocolates and cakes that are almost too beautiful to eat. Whether you're craving a cozy breakfast, a leisurely brunch, or simply a peaceful coffee break, this spot has something for everyone.
name: Cafe am Dom

excerpt: Family-run traditional brewery with an old-world brew pub serving regional food, plus a beer garden.
detail_description: Mahr's Bräu is a family-owned brewery with an authentic brew pub that offers regional cuisine and a charming beer garden. Located just a short train ride away from Nuremberg, this traditional brewery is a popular spot for locals and visitors alike. During warm weather, the beer garden becomes the main attraction, offering a lively atmosphere. The brewery and tavern are situated near each other, with a small garden out front for guests to enjoy.
name: Mahr's Bräu

excerpt: Bar bites & drinks served in a sprawling, laid-back beer garden that has occasional concerts.
detail_description: Wilde-Rose-Keller is a laid-back beer garden with a sprawling outdoor space that hosts occasional concerts. It offers a spacious and leafy environment, making it an ideal spot to enjoy cool drinks and good food during the summer. Unlike other Kellers in the area, Wilde-Rose-Keller allows patrons to bring their own food. The venue's relaxed atmosphere and ample shade make it a popular choice for visitors seeking a pleasant outdoor experience.
name: Wilde-Rose-Keller

detail_description: Kapuzinerbeck is a popular bakery in Bamberg, known for its freshly baked treats including buckwheat bread, cornbread, and various pastries. Customers praise the delicious cakes and the wide variety of baked goods available. The bakery is conveniently located for a morning stroll to pick up breakfast items. While parking may be challenging, visitors appreciate the fair prices and friendly service at this top bakery in Bamberg.
name: Kapuzinerbeck

detail_description: The Bamberg State Library, located within the campus grounds of the New Residence palace, is a must-see attraction in the region. The library houses a fantastic selection of books and features very friendly staff, making it one of the most beautiful and best libraries around. Visitors can enjoy easy lending processes and a fantastic surrounding environment.
name: Bamberg State Library

detail_description: The Theater der Schatten in Bamberg offers a unique evening experience for both tourists and locals. The 1.5-hour performance tells an intriguing story about the city's creation, showcasing different historical periods and immersing the audience in a mysterious atmosphere. Visitors praise the informative presentation of Bamberg's history, finding it engaging and entertaining. The old chapel setting adds to the overall ambiance, although it may not be accessible for wheelchairs.
name: Theater der Schatten

excerpt: Part-formed bust of a Roman centurion inspired by Pompeii designed by Igor Mitoraj in 1987.
detail_description: The "Centurione" by Igor Mitoraj is a captivating and unique tourist attraction. It is a partially-formed bust of a Roman centurion, inspired by Pompeii, created in 1987. The artwork blends seamlessly with the town's scenery and creates a living sculpture that attracts many visitors. Located on the river cross-bridge, it has become one of the popular spots in Bamberg, making it a must-see for those visiting this town.
name: Igor Mitoraj "Centurione"

detail_description: The artwork "Lying Woman with Fruit" by Fernando Botero showcases a sculpture that requires an appreciation for the artist's style. Placed in a well-suited setting, the spacious square enhances its beauty. If you happen to be in Bamberg, it is worth taking the time to pause and visit this unique piece of art. There aren't many free works by Botero available, making it even more special. These statues are alive and represent the joy of embracing life itself.
name: Liegende Frau mit Frucht von Fernando Botero

excerpt: Natural-history specimens, historic taxidermy & science exhibits in a bright former Jesuit college.
detail_description: Naturkundemuseum Bamberg, housed in a former Jesuit college, offers a unique blend of historical and modern natural history exhibits. It specializes in geology, paleontology, and Ice Age finds spanning the last 250 million years. The museum provides a comprehensive understanding of the region's geological formation and the evolution of flora and fauna during the Ice Ages. Despite some older exhibits, it offers great value for money with well-labeled displays and an intriguing film on biosphere formation.
name: Naturkundemuseum Bamberg

detail_description: Bamberg Tourismus is a charming town in northern Bavaria, Germany, situated on 7 hills at the confluence of the Regnitz and Main rivers. The old town boasts well-preserved buildings dating from the 11th to 19th centuries, including the picturesque Altes Rathaus and the impressive Bamberg Cathedral. Visitors can explore distinct beer taverns and enjoy delicious local brews. However, some challenges include limited parking space and occasional issues with facilities like public toilets.
name: BAMBERG Tourismus

detail_description: Skulpturengruppe "Meeting" is a captivating tourist spot situated near the Altes Rathaus in a charming town abundant in heritage and remarkable architectural structures. This delightful sculpture exhibit provides an entertaining and humorous experience, with no admission fee required. Additionally, every Friday, the Animalrebellion movement gathers here for their cause, which may appear intriguing to some despite its nature being somewhat puzzling.
name: Skulpturengruppe „Meeting“

detail_description: The Karmelitenkloster Bamberg, also known as the Carmelite Monastery Bamberg, is a historic site that dates back to the 12th century. The monastery underwent significant Baroque-style renovations and expansions in the late 17th century, resulting in its attractive appearance today. Visitors can still see remnants of its earlier Romanesque architecture, particularly in the late 13th-century cloister.
name: Karmelitenkloster Bamberg

detail_description: The Hainbadestelle outdoor swimming pool, located in the Luisenhain area, is a serene and picturesque spot that offers an ideal setting to unwind and relax during summer. The bathing spot has been in existence since 1935 and sits on the left bank of Regnitzarm with changing rooms, showers, restrooms, a modest snack bar, kiddie pool as well as a grassy area for those who prefer to bask under trees' shade.
name: Hainbadestelle

detail_description: Kreuzigungsgruppe, a historical landmark, is a magnificent place to visit. This site boasts several shops offering diverse activities that are sure to captivate visitors. The locals in this area are known for their warm and welcoming nature. At the base of the town lies a flowing river with a picturesque bridge spanning across it. Sitting on this bridge, one can indulge in the serene beauty of the river while being serenaded by the melodious chirping of birds.
name: Kreuzigungsgruppe

excerpt: Museum featuring a large nativity set, antique cribs from around the world & Christmas exhibits.
detail_description: The Bamberger Krippenmuseum is a museum with a large nativity set, antique cribs from around the world, and Christmas exhibits. It is an interesting and unique place that is definitely worth a visit during your stay in Bamberg.
name: Bamberger Krippenmuseum

detail_description: In the picturesque city of Bamberg, a stunning statue stands in front of a charming pastel-colored building. This is the Saint Empress Kunigunde statue, honoring Kunigunde of Luxembourg, who became empress of the Holy Roman Empire. Despite not having children with her husband Henry IV, she is revered as a saint for her charitable work after his passing. The statue offers a great view of the Regnitz river and is located near other popular attractions in Bamberg.
name: Saint Empress Kunigunde statue

detail_description: In the charming town of Bamberg, there lies a magnificent ancient fountain that greets visitors at the entrance to the old town. This stunning historical landmark is a sight to behold, capturing the essence of centuries gone by. With its timeless beauty and intricate design, it stands as a testament to the city's rich cultural heritage. As you approach this captivating structure, you will be transported back in time, immersing yourself in an atmosphere of history and tradition.
name: Brunnen/ fountain
